summary: Team introductions and role confirmations: PM Sarah asked what to work on, Developer Alex requested assignments, QA Jordan is ready to test with expected-output guidance, and Architect Mike is available for design questions.

actions.task: Prioritize the backlog and assign specific work items to the developer and QA
Pick up assigned development tasks or ask PM for clarification on priorities and scope
Run tests when handed off and validate results using the provided "Expected output" string; report results back to the team
Provide architecture/design guidance and answer any design questions from the team

risks.risk: No tasks have been assigned yet, which could cause developer idle time and delay progress
risks.mitigation: PM to prioritize backlog and assign tasks promptly; set clear due dates and expectations

risks.risk: Testing criteria not provided with handoffs, risking ambiguous test acceptance
risks.mitigation: Require the handoff message "Ready for testing!" to include the Expected output string and any acceptance criteria before QA begins testing
